member.name: T:EPiServer.CacheManager
member.summary: Centralized object for handling cache expiration with support for web farms.
member.remarks:
If you need to expire a custom cached item you should call the Remove method instead of calling the .NET methods. This will ensure that your application will operate correctly in a load-balanced environment. There are also some helper methods to add items to the cache.
Note CacheManager does not have its own internal cache, it will operate against the global ASP.NET Cache class.

member.name: F:EPiServer.CacheManager.LocalCacheManagerRaiserId
member.summary: The ID of the local cache manager.
member.remarks: Used by the remote event system to identify who originally created an event and determine appropriate action.

member.name: F:EPiServer.CacheManager.RemoveFromCacheEventId
member.summary: The ID used to identify cache removals requested by the CacheManager.

member.name: F:EPiServer.CacheManager.VersionKey
member.summary: The name of the cache key that is updated on every cache change handled by CacheManager.

member.name: M:EPiServer.CacheManager.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes item from the local cache and other remote cache listeners.
member.remarks: This method will automatically forward updates to other machines. Do not use this method in loops, since every call could result in a web service call to multiple machines. The recommended pattern when you have multiple items that needs to be removed is to have a master dependency item that can be removed instead, to trigger all items to be removed.

member.name: M:EPiServer.CacheManager.RemoveLocalOnly(System.String)
member.summary: Removes item from the local cache and other remote cache listeners.

member.name: M:EPiServer.CacheManager.RemoveRemoteOnly(System.String)
member.summary: Removes item from remote cache listeners.
member.remarks: This method will not update version or remove item from local cache.

member.name: M:EPiServer.CacheManager.Insert(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts an item in the cache.
member.param: The string key of the item.

member.name: M:EPiServer.CacheManager.Insert(System.String,System.Object,EPiServer.Framework.Cache.CacheEvictionPolicy)
member.summary: Inserts an item in the cache.
member.param: The string key of the item.

member.name: M:EPiServer.CacheManager.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an item from the cache.

member.name: P:EPiServer.CacheManager.CacheImplementation
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache implementation that CacheManager uses.

member.name: M:EPiServer.CacheManager.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items that have been added to the cache.
member.note: Currently only the local cache is affected.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.BasicContent.CreateWriteableCloneImplementation
member.summary: Creates a writable clone of this object.
member.returns: A clone of this object that is writable.

remarks.para: This method is called by . If you are inheriting, directly or indirectly, from you should override this method to make sure that all reference type members of your class are cloned.

Your override of this method must create the clone by calling base.CreateWritableCloneImplementation(). This ensures that all classes in the inheritance chain can create clones as necessary. Also, by calling the base implementation the values of all value type members are copied as the implementation of this method calls .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content/listing should be added to cache. If value is true to the content/listing will not be added to cache.
member.value: true if the content/listing should not be added to cache; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.CacheSettings.SlidingExpiration
member.summary: The interval between the time the added object was last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If absolute expiration is used, the slidingExpiration parameter must be "System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoSlidingExpiration".

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.CacheSettings.AbsoluteExpiration
member.summary: The time at which the added object expires and is removed from the cache. If you are using sliding expiration, the absoluteExpiration parameter must be "System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration".

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.CacheSettings.CacheKeys
member.summary: An list of cache keys that is monitored for changes. When any of these cache keys changes, the cached content instance becomes obsolete and is removed from the cache.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.CacheSettings.MasterKeys
member.summary: An list of master keys that is monitored for changes. When any of these cache keys changes, the cached content instance becomes obsolete and is removed from the cache.
member.remarks: Master keys are used as markers to set up common dependencies without having to create the cache entries first. If you set up a master key dependency, there is no need for the corresponding entry to exist before adding something that depends on the master key.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.CacheSettings.FileNames
member.summary: An list of paths (to files or directories) that the cached object is dependent upon. When any of these resources changes, the cached IContent becomes obsolete and is removed from the cache.

member.summary: Creates a writable clone of this object.
member.returns: A clone of this object that is writable.

remarks.para: This method is called by . If you are inheriting, directly or indirectly, from you should override this method to make sure that all reference type members of your class are cloned.

Your override of this method must create the clone by calling base.CreateWritableCloneImplementation(). This ensures that all classes in the inheritance chain can create clones as necessary. Also, by calling the base implementation the values of all value type members are copied as the implementation of this method calls .

remarks.para: Note that this indexer will use the Pre and Post handlers for property lookup, i.e. the returned values are not guaranteed to belong to the page, but may be from a different source link dynamic properties or another page when is set to the value of .
To get data guaranteed to belong to this page, use the and methods.

Also note that setting values with this indexer will only set values that acually belong to the page, i.e. you may get a valid value by reading from the indexer, but trying to set a new value for the same index may yield an exception if the value does not exist in the page.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.ContentFolder.CreateWriteableCloneImplementation
member.summary: Creates a writable clone of this object.
member.returns: A clone of this object that is writable.

remarks.para: This method is called by . If you are inheriting, directly or indirectly, from you should override this method to make sure that all reference type members of your class are cloned.

Your override of this method must create the clone by calling base.CreateWritableCloneImplementation(). This ensures that all classes in the inheritance chain can create clones as necessary. Also, by calling the base implementation the values of all value type members are copied as the implementation of this method calls .

member.name: T:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities
member.summary: Specifies which capabilitites that a content provider instance supports. The class will during it's initialization read the passed in configaration values and see which capabilites attributes that are present and set the capabilities for the page provider instance from those values.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.None
member.summary: The provider supports only read of pages.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.Create
member.summary: Supports creation of new pages
member.remarks: The ContentProvider class implementation will check if attribute "create" exist in configruation attributes and has value "true" if so it returns true else it returns false.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.Edit
member.summary: Supports editing of existing pages
member.remarks: The ContentProvider class implementation will check if attribute "edit" exist in configruation attributes and has value "true" if so it returns true else it returns false.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.Delete
member.summary: Supports deletion of pages
member.remarks: The ContentProvider class implementation will check if attribute "delete" exist in configruation attributes and has value "true" if so it returns true else it returns false.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.Move
member.summary: Supports moving of pages internally within the pages served by the provider. To support moving of pages between different page providers the capability that has to supported is Create/>.
member.remarks: The ContentProvider class implementation will check if attribute "move" exist in configruation attributes and has value "true" if so it returns true else it returns false.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.Copy
member.summary: Supports copy of pages internally within the pages served by the provider. To support copy of pages between different page providers the capability that has to supported is Create/>.
member.remarks: The ContentProvider class implementation will check if attribute "copy" exist in configruation attributes and has value "true" if so it returns true else it returns false.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.MultiLanguage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating wether this page provider instance supports pages with multiple languages
member.remarks: The ContentProvider class implementation will check if attribute "multiLanguage" exist in configruation attributes and has value "true" if so it returns true else it returns false.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.Security
member.summary: Gets a value indicating wether this page provider instance supports access checks
member.remarks: The ContentProvider class implementation will check if attribute "security" exist in configruation attributes and has value "true" if so it returns true else it returns false.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.ContentProviderCapabilities.Search
member.summary: Supports search in page data served by the provider.
member.remarks: The ContentProvider class implementation will check if attribute "search" exist in configruation attributes and has value "true" if so it returns true else it returns false.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.ContentReference.WorkID
member.summary: The version id of a instance.
member.remarks: This is an internal representation of versions. I e it is not a sequential version number for the content, but can contain any value. The only guarantee is that if content version A is created before content version B, then A.WorkID < B.WorkID

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.ContentReference.ProviderName
member.summary: A string that identifies a a provider that serves the content. For content served by default provider this value is null.
member.remarks: To see if the ContentReference is extern, use the IsExternProvider method rather than looking at the ProviderName.
member.value: True if it is a extern reference.
member.exception: Thrown if the instance is read-only.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.ContentReference.GetPublishedOrLatest
member.summary: Indicates if the references a specific version or may be used to load the latest version.
member.returns: true if the latest should be loaded; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
This property only returns true if the object was created via the constructor. Typically, that constructor is used when you want to load the latest version a regardless if it's published or not. When GetPublishedOrLatest is set then the loading will not take fallback or replacement language settings into account.
When a with GetPublishedOrLatest is set to true is passed to the returned object will be, in order of preference:
The currently published version
The latest saved version
If GetPublishedOrLatest is set to true, any value assigned to will be ignored. This setting is mainly used internally from edit of content and should be used with care since it might bypass cache.

member.returns: True if it is a content provider.
member.remarks: A ContentReference can point to an external provider as indicated by the property.

member.summary: Changes the into a read-only object.

After calling this method, any attempt to modify this instance or any contained object will generate a . I e the semantics is "deep read-only".
Note! After setting an object to read-only it is not possible to revert back to read-write mode. You will have to call the CreateWritableClone method to get a copy that can be modified.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Core.EPiServerException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown by EPiServer when a non-fatal error occurs.
member.example:
Example of throwing a exception with error message translated into different languages, see for more information about adding custom language resources.
throw new EPiServerException("My custom error","/customerror/genericfail");

remarks.para: All non-fatal exceptions in EPiServer is derived from this class.
If an exception occurs while translating a message the default message will be displayed instead, otherwise the actual cause of a exception could be hidden.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified principal has the requested access.
member.returns: true if the specified principal has access; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Note that the access level is a bitmask, i e we simply check that all specified access types are granted to the principal.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.Html.StringParsing.PersonalizedContentSecurityDescriptor.GetAccessLevel(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Returns the access level for the specified principal.
member.param: The principal to check access against.
member.returns: The access level.
member.remarks: Use this method when you want to get the union of all access types granted to this principal. This is most likely only used for display purposes in the user interface. Code that checks access and performs different actions depending on the type of access granted should use the HasAccess method, since it does what you want and has the potential for being much faster.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Core.Licensing
member.summary: Class that handles all EPiServer related licensing
member.remarks: Use to determine if this installation has a valid license. This might be useful if some of your functions cannot operate when the restrictions are enforced when a non-valid license is in used. For example DataFactory may throw exceptions if you are running a scheduled job without a license. Otherwise error messages will be appended to output.

member.summary: Determines if current used license is a commercial license

member.summary: Get message returned by license check

member.name: T:EPiServer.Core.PageData
member.summary: Represents the content and meta data about a specific page.

remarks.para: The PageData class contains content and meta data about a specific page. This includes the name of the page (), reference () and URL ().

PageData is in many respects synonymous with the web page that it is holding properties for. One example of this is the property, which holds last date and time the PageData object, in other words the web page, was changed.

member.summary: Constructor that creates a new instance by shallow copying the state from another instance.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.ContentLink
member.summary: Gets or sets the content link. It used to hold references to content in the EPiServer system.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.EPiServer#Core#IContent#ParentLink
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent link. It used to hold references to the parent content in the EPiServer system.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.PageLink
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the current page.
member.remarks: The use of PageLink is derived from the way in which EPiServer is structured. Pages are nothing more than an instance of an EPiServer page type and a collection of property settings stored in the database. Individual pages are identified by the pkID column in the database table tblPage and transforming this into a URL, you get something looking like "templates/emailpagecontainer.aspx?id=n?", where "n" is the previously mentioned pkID and thus the unique page identifier.

example.para: The following example demonstrates the usage of PageLink in HTML.

As PageLink is guaranteed to be unique among all pages in a certain EPiServer instances, it is used in the following example to create unique IDs and names for HTML check boxes. The code is used to present the visitor with a selection of pages and allows them to select one or more for further processing.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.ParentLink
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the page that is the closest parent of this page.
member.remarks: Parent and childhood is determined by placement in the page tree.

example.para: In the following code example ParentLink is used twice. First make sure it contains a non-empty PageReference and secondly to retrieve the sibling of the current page.
The following code example demonstrates the usage of ParentLink. The example results in the name of the parent page being displayed.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.ArchiveLink
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to a page where the page will be archived to when the data has passed.
member.returns: A PageReference that indicates where to archive this page when the StopPublish date has passed.
member.remarks: Note that the scheduled job "Archive pages" must run for the page to be archived.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.Category
member.summary: Gets a containing the categories that this page belongs to.
member.returns: A CategoryList with the categories.

remarks.para: This is used to determine which categories that the page belongs to, it should not be confused with a property of type PropertyCategory defined on the page type.
If there is no "PageCategory" property, a null object will be returned.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.PageName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name of page.
member.remarks: Not many page settings are under absolute editor control, but PageName is one of them. PageName is a descriptive name given the page in Edit mode. PageName can be used to great benefit in many cases, such as templated controls.

example.para: The following example demonstrates the usage of PageName and LinkURL. The HTML code below produces two HTML table rows for every news item page displayed. The first row displays the content of the property PageStartPublish and the second row is an HTML anchor tag, where PageData.LinkURL is the relative URL for the page and PageData.PageName is used as a new headline. Note that PageData.Item is used twice in this HTML code, as the two attributes PageStartPublish and MainIntro are accessed using the indexer for the PageData property.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.LinkURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to this page.

remarks.para: The LinkURL string property contains root-relative path and query of the URL for the page, in other words to get an absolute URL, prepend LinkURL with the appropriate scheme and host.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.TargetFrameName
member.summary: Get the specified target frame for links to this page

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.LinkType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of URL that should be used for this page.

member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to this page as stored in the database.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.URLSegment
member.summary: Gets or sets the segment that represents this page in an URL.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.ExternalURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the page's external URL.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.WorkPageID
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the current version of this page.
member.returns: An integer representing the version ID.
member.remarks: Note that the current implementation of WorkPageID will be strictly increasing with later versions, but you should avoid relying on this aspect and just treat WorkPageID as an opaque identity without any implied semantics.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if this page is pending archiving and should be moved to its archive folder.
member.returns: True if the page should be archived now.
member.remarks: This is a utility property that checks if the page has an archive folder and its date has passed.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.PageTypeName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the used to create this page.
member.returns: A string with the name.
member.remarks: This is the page type name as entered in Admin mode. It will not be translated in any way. PageTypeName is the same as column Name in the database table tblPageType.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.IsDeleted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the page has been deleted. It is marked as deleted if it resides in the wastebasket.
member.returns: true if the page is in the wastebasket, otherwise false
member.remarks: Since a deletion of a page moves the page to wastebasket rather than deleting it directly, you can use this property to check if the page is deleted or if it is live.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.DeletedBy
member.summary: Gets a value indicating who deleted the page.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.Deleted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating when the page has been deleted.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.VisibleInMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this page should be visible in menus and tree structures.

remarks.para: Setting VisibleInMenu to false is way to hide a page so that it will not be displayed in conjunction with other sibling items in the tree, which would otherwise happen automatically. It is typically filtered by, or close to, the presentation layer.
VisibleInMenu is stored in the column VisibleInMenu in database table tblContent.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.PendingPublish
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if this page is pending publishing.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PageData.ACL
member.summary: Gets the list of access permissions of this page. This describes what access certain users and roles has to this page.

remarks.para: ACL holds the Access Control List for a PageData object. Since PageData has the attribute Property which is a PropertyDataCollection, ACL effectively controls access to the web page. Keep in mind that the Access Control List applies to all of the PageData object and its attributes. It is not possible to have different access permissions for different properties.
The Acccess Control List is comprised of an Access Control Entry, ACE, array and is accessed by calling the method ACL.ToRawACEArray.

example.para: The following code example demonstrates the usage of ToRawACEArray to enumerate the Access Control Entries. The example enumerates the objects, which together form the Access Control List and check if one of them is the Create permission.
The following code example demonstrates the usage of QueryDistinctAccess to check specific access for the current user.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.PageData.Copy
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of the current object, as opposed to a shallow copy.
member.returns: A new PageData.

remarks.para: In most cases you will probably want to use the new method instead, since copying a read-only instance will return a new read-only instance.
This method performs a deep copy and the copy should therefore have no references to the original PageData instance. This is to say that you can freely modify the copy without altering the original.

member.remarks: Used internally to filter pages in listings. You should usually not need to refer to this method directly.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Core.PageDataCollection
member.summary: A collection of PageData objects.

remarks.para: Control authors might need to fill this kind of collection from code. Mostly you'll work on collections retrieved by a GetChildren(...) call or from a Web control.

The GetChildren(...) method defined on the IPageSource interface returns a PageDataCollection. The IPageSource interface is implemented by many classes like PageBase (and descendants), DataFactory, PageControlBase (which most Web controls inherit from) and more.

PageDataCollection is often used together with other EPiServer classes, see the following HowTo articles which demonstrate some ways in which it can be used: Search for pages created recently and Search for pages based on page type property.

member.example: The following code example demonstrates the usage of PageDataCollection.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Core.PagePublishedStatus.Published
member.summary: Include page if it has been published and current time is between start publish and stop publish. This is the normal case.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.PropertyCategory.MakeReadOnly
member.summary: Sets internal to read-only as well as calling the base class

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PropertyCategory.LanguageBranch
member.summary: Gets or sets the language branch that this object belongs to.
member.remarks:
This is a special case property that is only set/used when a PropertyCategory is used as a dynamic property. This property is needed because the traditional "Parent" discovery method for language branch does not work in that case.
This property also solves a "chicken-or-egg" problem that we used to have when we created a DynamicProperty object wrapping a PropertyCategory: 1. We must pass in the PropertyCategory value the DynamicProperty constructor. 2. We must know the language branch to load the value. 3. Once created, the DynamicProperty object knows the language branch.

member.summary: Gets the description. Used in the admin UI to distinguish between global settings.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.PropertySettings.PropertySettings.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is the default setting for the instances .
member.value: true if this instance is default; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The order of importance used when a property setting is resolved is:

list.item: Specific settings for property definition as defined in the UI.
Specific settings from code (attribute on the model property).
User defined property settings marked as default in the UI.
A instance with the correct settings type marked as .
Default settings from the actual settings class.

member.name: P:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.Activities.ActivityOptions.ArchiveRetentionPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of months that activities should remain archived before they are deleted.
member.remarks: The default value is 12 months. A value of zero (0) indicates that activities should be deleted immediately. A negative value indicates that the archive should be kept indefinitely (not recommended).

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.Activities.ActivityOrder.AsRecorded
member.summary: Indicates that activities should be returned in the order that they were recorded, i.e. oldest to newest

member.summary: The method called by IReadOnly.CreateWritableClone.
member.returns: A clone of this object that is writable.

remarks.para: This method is called by . If you are inheriting, directly or indirectly, from you should override this method to make sure that all reference type members of your class are cloned.

Your override of this method must create the clone by calling base.CreateWritableCloneImplementation(). This ensures that all classes in the inheritance chain can create clones as necessary. Also, by calling the base implementation the values of all value type members are copied as 's implementation of this method calls .

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.DynamicProperty
member.summary: Read and edit dynamic properties.
member.remarks: EPiServer.DataAbstraction.DynamicProperty is a non-cached API for administrative purposes and should not be used on normal templates that are not for administrative purposes. Using this API on your templates will significally impact performance. The recommendation is always to read dynamic properties on PageData objects returned from the global instance of the DataFactory class, EPiServer.DataFactory.Instance.

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.Internal.TypeReferenceAnalyzer
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Analyses a type looking for properties of a specified type.

remarks.para: Recursively goes through the public properties of a type and searches for those of a specified typed. Will throw exception if a circular reference is encountered.
Only properties with a public get and set accessor will be validated.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.Internal.TypeReferenceAnalyzer.Analyze``1(System.Type)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Analyze a type for occurrances of a specified base type

remarks.para: Analyze a type looking for properties of a specified type. Will do so recursivly using reflection on public properties with getter and setter.
Validates if any property of a specific type creates a circular reference. Will throw an exception in that case.

member.typeparam: The public properties have to inherit from this type to be considered a match.
member.exception: If circular references are found
member.returns: The types found matching the parameter. Ordered with the deepest matches first.

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.ITypeReferenceAnalyzer
member.summary: Analyzes types for type usages.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.ITypeReferenceAnalyzer.Analyze``1(System.Type)
member.summary: Analyze a type for occurrances of a specified base type

remarks.para: Analyze a type looking for properties of a specified type. Will do so recursivly using reflection on public properties with getter and setter.
Validates if any property of a specific type creates a circular reference. Will throw an exception in that case.

member.typeparam: The public properties have to inherit from this type to be considered a match.
member.exception: If circular references are found
member.returns: The types found matching the parameter. Ordered with the deepest matches first.

member.name: P:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.PageType.FileName
member.summary: RootRelative url to the actual template file (i.e. something starting with "/"). If the backing path from the database is relative (i.e. not starting with "/"), it will be interpreted as relative to the (possibly relocated) UI-folder before being returned as a root-relative path. If the name begins with a magic placeholder (i.e. {EPsUploadDir} or {EPsRootDir}) it is returned unchanged. If the path has not been set null is returned.

member.remarks: Published and previously published content will be ignored since they are considered already published.

member.remarks: No filtering or other validation will be done of the content, the project items should be ready to publish.

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.RuntimeModel.Internal.ContentDataInterceptorHook
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Makes sure the proxy does not override methods that should not be proxied, for perf reasons
member.remarks: Pure function, is a function that for given set of inputs always returns the same output. In case of proxy generation hook, it means that two equal (as specified by overridden Equals/GetHashCode methods) proxy generation hooks will for given type to proxy return the same values from their methods, and when asked again about the same type will again return the same values/throw the same exceptions. http://docs.castleproject.org/Tools.Make-proxy-generation-hooks-purely-functional.ashx

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.ScheduledJob
member.summary: Read, edit and execute scheduled jobs

remarks.para: The best way to create a custom scheduled job is to use the as it will automatically generate a settings page in admin mode.
All dates exposed by ScheduledJob are in local time, but they will be saved to the database as UTC dates.

example.para: Example that demonstrates listing all available jobs.

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction
member.summary: Describes the type of action to perform when saving a content item.

remarks.para: This enumeration contains both primary commands (CheckIn, Publish, Schedule) that defines the main action and option flags (ForceNewVersion, ForceCurrentVersion) that provide additional information about the save operation.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.Default
member.summary: Save content without updating the status.

remarks.para: When the saved content is or a new version with status will be created.
When combined with a new version with status will be created.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.None
member.summary: Replaced by .

summary.para: NOTE: This action has some inconsistent behavior and has been deprecated in favour of either or depending on your needs. This action will be obsoleted and removed in a future version.
Save content, leaving it in a checked out state.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.CheckIn
member.summary: Save and transition content to state.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.Publish
member.summary: Save and publish content. Content will transition to a state.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.Reject
member.summary: Save and transition content to the state.

summary.para: NOTE: This is a pre-release saveAction that is UNSTABLE and might not satisfy the compatibility requirements as denoted by its associated normal version.
Save and transition content to state.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.CheckOut
member.summary: Save and transition content to a state, creating a new version if not already checked-out.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.Schedule
member.summary: Save and schedule content to be published. Content will transition to a state.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.ForceNewVersion
member.summary: Option that ensures that a new version is created when saving preventing the current content from being overwritten.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.ForceCurrentVersion
member.summary: Option that will ensure that the any existing version is updated.
member.remarks: This option will be ignored if used when saving a new item.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.SkipValidation
member.summary: Option that indicates that the content data should not be validated against .
member.remarks: Use with caution, especially when publishing content.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.DelayedPublish

summary.para: NOTE: This action has been replaced by the primary action and will be removed in a future version.
Save and check in content, creating a new version only if necessary and sets the content as delayed publish.

member.remarks: This action must always be combined with the action when used.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.SkipSetCommonDraft
member.summary: Option to avoid setting the version as the commond draft in cases where the save results in a new version being created.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.Patch
member.summary: Update the current version without changing the status or trigger any validation.
member.remarks: Use with caution, especially with published content.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction.ActionMask
member.summary: Mask that can be used to clear option flags from a combined SaveAction value.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveActionExtentions.Command(EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction)
member.summary: Gets the primary command of a combined save action.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveActionExtentions.Options(EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction)
member.summary: Gets the options part of a combined save action.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveActionExtentions.ToReadableString(EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction)
member.summary: As the ToString("F") method sometimes confusingly includes "Default" you can use this method when creating exception messages to ensure that it's not included .

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAnnotations.AccessAttribute

remarks.para: This attribute only has effect if it is paired with the . The values from this attribute are used to create the ACL list on the object. Access rights can be set for Users, Roles and Visitor groups.
Refer to "Attributes" and "Pages, Page Types and Page Templates" under "Content" in the Developer Guide for more information and examples.

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAnnotations.AvailableContentTypesAttribute
member.summary: Defines which content types that should be available under a

remarks.para: The diffent properties of the attribute are applied in the following way:

item.description: Include implicitly exclude all PageTypes not in the list.
Exclude implicitly include all PageTypes not in the list.
IncludeOn and ExcludeOn combine with the settings on the target PageType. If there is a conflict Exclude/ExcludeOn have precedency over Include/IncludeOn.

remarks.para: Refer to "Attributes" and "Pages, Page Types and Page Templates" under "Content" in the Developer Guide for more information and examples.

member.example: Here is an example on how you can set available page types on your page types using this attribute.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Notification.INotifier.PostNotificationAsync(EPiServer.Notification.NotificationMessage)
member.summary: Posts a message for delivery. The delivery of the message depends on user settings, which and that are registered.

remarks.para: can be used to configure if an message should be processed immediately or scheduled. By default are messages processed scheduled.

When is completed the messages is stored for send processing. However even if is configured for channel the actual send process is done in background, in case of the processing is triggered without waiting for next scheduling.

member.name: T:EPiServer.PlugIn.PagePlugInAttribute
member.summary: The attribute class used to identify page extensions.
member.remarks: Page extensions are plug-ins that are automatically instantiated and used for all ASP.NET pages that derive (directly or indirectly) from the class. All EPiServers system pages derive from PageBase and this is a way to hook in custom code to basically any user / editor / admin page and add new functionality.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the page extension.
The description for the page extension.
member.remarks: Initializes the and properties as part of the initialization process. Unless you manually set the property you will not benefit from the automatic translation support in EPiServer.

member.name: M:EPiServer.PlugIn.PagePlugInAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of the page extension.
The description for the page extension.
The language path to use when trying to look up translations for the DisplayName and Description properties.

member.summary: Initialization method called by the plug-in system.
member.remarks: This method is called to set up all page extensions by invoking the static Initialize method on the class that the PagePlugInAttribute is applied to.

member.name: M:EPiServer.PlugIn.PagePlugInAttribute.GetOptionFlag
member.summary: Gets the option flag.
member.returns: An with the next available bit for Page Extension use.
member.remarks: Note that this is used as a bitmap to determine which page extensions to enable. This effectively limits the number of installed page extensions to 32.

member.name: T:EPiServer.PlugIn.PlugInAttribute
member.summary: The base class for all specialized plug-in types

remarks.para: When an area that support plug-ins executes in EPiServer it will search for files in the bin directory and their containing classes for an attribute called . The PlugInAttribute is only a base class for all specialized plug-in types and is not actually used anywhere to define a plug-in, only to search and match plug-ins that used attributes derived from PlugInAttribute.

The class that handles searching is , probably you dont need to use this class unless you are implementing your own plug-in support. It returns a array of classes, PlugInDescriptor contains information about the PlugInAttribute definition and the plug-in id that was assigned to the plug-in in this installation.

member.name: T:EPiServer.PlugIn.ScheduledPlugInAttribute
member.summary: A plugin to have a scheduled job with a simple user interface in admin mode

remarks.para: The class must implement a public static method with name "Execute", it will be called on the interval specified in administration mode. An optional return value can be specified for a descriptive text.

Important! If you change the class or namespace name the old scheduled job will still be active but without a settings page, you should manually delete this job from the database in table tblScheduledItem.
The property HelpFile can be set to link to a custom help page for the job.

member.example: A simple example of a scheduled class, the return type could be void if you don't want to return a descriptive message. Throwing a exception will in this case show up as "FAILED" on the history tab i admin mode.

member.name: P:EPiServer.PlugIn.ScheduledPlugInAttribute.Restartable
member.summary: Indicates if the Job is restartable. A restartable job restarts immediately if the job is aborted or not running.
member.remarks: When an application controlled or uncontrolled getting server shutdown then jobs can be marked as aborted. When the application restarts, the jobs that are marked as restartable will be executed immediately if the has not exceeded the . Bacause a restartable job could started many times then it is important the job has capability to handle restart attempts.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Scheduler.Internal.WaitableTimer
member.summary:
Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Class WaitableTimer emulates the Win32 WaitableTimer concept by using an internal timer setting an AutoResetEvent object.
It uses a periodic timer to avoid problems with time span calculations.
The period of the timer (which affects the resolution) is by default one second. This can be changed with the parameterized constructor by setting the resolution parameter.
The precision of the timer (i e if it will signal on an even hour, minute, second etc) can be set with the precision parameter.

member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Internal timer callback function

member.name: T:EPiServer.Security.AccessControlList
member.summary: AccessControlList is used to restrict access to various items.

remarks.para: ACL holds the Access Control List for a PageData object. Since PageData has the attribute Property which is a PropertyDataCollection, ACL effectively controls access to the Web page. Keep in mind that the Access Control List applies to all of the PageData object and its attributes. It is not possible to have different access permissions for different properties.
The Access Control List is comprised of an Access Control Entry, ACE, array and is accessed by calling the method ACL.ToRawACEArray.

member.example:
The code example below demonstrates the usage of AccessControlList, RawACE and AccessControlEntry. The example below sets up access rights on a "personal" start page. Administrators gets full access, the creator gets everything except for administer and any other user/group that has at least read access on the team start page gets read access rights. The argument "page" is the page to update the access rights on.
The following code example demonstrates the usage of ToRawACEArray to enumerate the Access Control Entries. The example enumerates the EPiServer.Security.RawAce objects, which together form the Access Control List and check if one of them is the Create permission.
The following code example demonstrates the usage of QueryDistinctAccess to check specific access for the current user.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Security.ISecurable
member.summary: The ISecurable interface is implemented by any object that has access restrictions.
member.remarks: In order to decouple domain objects from the access check / security management responsibilities, the process of checking access rights are split into two parts: first you get the security descriptor from the secured object, then you check access rights on the security descriptor.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.ISecurable.GetSecurityDescriptor
member.summary: Gets the security descriptor.
member.returns: An implementation of ISecurityDescriptor.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Security.ISecurityDescriptor
member.summary: The interface for a Security descriptor, i e something that allows for checking access rights.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.ISecurityDescriptor.HasAccess(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal,EPiServer.Security.AccessLevel)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified principal has the requested access.
member.returns: true if the specified principal has access; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Note that the access level is a bitmask, i.e. we simply check that all specified access types are granted to the principal.
If the current is inherited, this method will check the inherited access rights.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.ISecurityDescriptor.GetAccessLevel(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Retreives the access level for the specified principal.
member.param: The principal get access rights for.
member.returns: The access level that the specified principal has.

remarks.para: Use this method when you want to get the union of all access types granted to this principal. This is most likely only used for display purposes in the user interface. Code that checks access and performs different actions depending on the type of access granted should use the HasAccess method, since it does what you want and has the potential for being much faster.
If the current is inherited, this method checks the inherited access rights.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Security.RawACE
member.summary: Raw data contained in AccessControlList
member.example: The code example below demonstrates the usage of AccessControlList, RawACE and AccessControlEntry. The example below sets up access rights on a "personal" start page. Administrators gets full access, the creator gets everything except for administer and any other user/group that has at least read access on the team start page gets read access rights. page is the page to update the access rights on.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Security.RawACE.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name.
member.remarks: This property contains logic to deal with the EPiServer 4 concept of SID (Security IDentifiers - not identical to the SIDs as used by Windows). Importing data from an EPiServer 4 site just gives you the SID, not the actual user / role name and this property will map a couple of well known SIDs into names.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.RawACE.EntityType
member.summary: The SecurityEntityType for this ACE.
member.remarks: This was added in CMS6R2, so any older package will have this value set to User.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.RawACE.SID
member.summary: A Security Identity for the ACE.
member.remarks: The concept of SIDs are obsolete as of EPiServer CMS 5, but due to compatibility with EPiServer 4 data this property has not yet been obsoleted. However you should avoid using it unless absolutely necessary.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.RawACE.Access
member.summary: The access level defined by this ACE.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Security.SecuritySaveType
member.summary: Describes different ways that access control can be saved

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.SecuritySaveType.None
member.summary: No type defined

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.SecuritySaveType.RecursiveReplace
member.summary: Recursivly saves the changed rows and deletes all rows that not been modified

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.SecuritySaveType.RecursiveModify
member.summary: Recursivly modifies selected rows

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.SecuritySaveType.Modify
member.summary: Modifies selected rows

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.SecuritySaveType.Replace
member.summary: Replaces any existing permissions with the new settings

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.SecuritySaveType.ReplaceChildPermissions
member.summary: Replaces existing permissions on all children to an item (existing permissions will be deleted)

remarks.para: The root item is not modified, you need to do a separate call using method Replace change a single item.
This option also overwrites any items that inherits permissions.

member.name: F:EPiServer.Security.SecuritySaveType.MergeChildPermissions
member.summary: Merges permissions on all children (permissions for roles and users are applied without removing existing permissions for other users and roles not being saved)

remarks.para: The root item is not modified, you need to do a separate call using method Replace change a single item.
This option does not overwrites any items that inherits their permissions.

member.name: M:EPiServer.SpecializedProperties.LinkItemCollection.MakeReadOnly
member.summary: Changes the object instance into a read-only object.
member.remarks:
After calling this method, any attempt to change the object instance or any contained object will generate a . I e the semantics is "deep read-only".
Note! After setting an object to read-only it is not possible to revert back to read-write mode. You will have to call the CreateWritableClone method to get a copy that can be modified.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.Internal.PathMatching
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Support for matching file and directory paths against predefined lists.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.Internal.PathMatching.AddPath(System.String)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Adds the path to the set of paths to match against.

remarks.para: If the path starts with a tilde ('~') it will be expanded to contain the actual application root.
The path is interpreted as a directory if it ends with a '/'. Adding a path such as "/abc/" will match against anything that starts with "/abc/", such as "/abc/def/ghi.html".
If the path does not end with a '/' it is interpreted as a file. Adding a file will only match against the exact path added.

member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Determines whether the specified path matches a previously added path.
member.returns: true if the specified path is match; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Will check against all added paths, both directories and files. The matching is case-insensitive.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.SiteDefinitionResolverExtensions.GetByContent(EPiServer.Web.ISiteDefinitionResolver,EPiServer.Core.ContentReference,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the for a content reference.
member.param: The site definition resolver that is being extended
if set to true and if content link is not under any site, use SiteDefinition mapped with Wildcard.
if set to true and if content link is not under any site, and not fallback to Wildcard use system default (StartPage and SiteUrl is not defined).
member.returns: A instance for the site that belongs to.

remarks.para: This is done by traversing the page tree upwards from current link until a Page that matches a StartPage for a registered .

If the is not located beneath a start page, the search will fall back to the instance for the site mapped with * as host is set to True. If the is not located beneath a start page, and if not fallen back to wildcard and is set to true then the system default setting will be returned which has for example RootPage set but not site specific settings like StartPage and SiteUrl.

member.summary: Gets or sets the route values.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.Routing.UrlResolverArguments.ForceCanonical
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the canonical URL should be returned if there are multiple hostnames defined for the site.

remarks.para: If not set explicitly, the hostname of the resolved URL will be dependent on the current context. If the resolved content is on a different site than the current, the canonical URL will always be returned. If the content is on the same site, the canonical URL will only be returned if the current hostname is set to be redirected.

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataFactoryCache
member.summary: Handles all page caching operations for DataFactory.

remarks.para: The DataFactoryCache class lets you manipulate the EPiServer cache directly, although you'll seldom need to do so. EPiServer uses the ASP.NET Cache class, which you can also manipulate if needed.
If you should need to insert data or change page relationships directly in the database, you can use this class to clear the cache, ensuring EPiServer loads the new data from the database.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataFactoryCache.CreateDependency(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference)
member.summary: Get a cache dependency for content item.
member.returns: A initialized cache dependency object

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataFactoryCache.UnInitialize(EPiServer.Core.IContentEvents)
member.summary: Undo the initialization.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataFactoryCache.RootKeyName
member.summary: Everything stored in the DataFactoryCache has a dependency on this key.

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataFactoryCache.VersionKey
member.summary: A global key that DataFactoryCache updates with a new version number everytime a content or listing is removed from cache. Targeted for use with output caching and other caching mechanism that cannot rely on a single item or page in EPiServer.
member.remarks: Does not update when content versions are changed

member.name: F:EPiServer.DataFactoryCache.PageCacheKeyPrefix
member.summary: Internal use. Exposed for testing purposes only.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataFactoryCache.AllowUploadEndpoints
member.summary: Start pre-populating the cache with content tree end-points.
member.remarks: This method is intended for internal use. Calling it will start an asynchronous job that reads all endpoints (content without children) from the content tree and puts this information into the cache. This is primarily useful to speed up the tree operations in edit mode.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Extensions.Internal.TypeExtensions.IsInterceptableType(System.Type)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Determines whether [is interceptable type] [the specified t].
member.remarks:
An interceptable type has following criteria
1- Should have both Getter and Setter CompilerGenerated property
2- The CompilerGenerated property should be virtual and Public
3- The CompilerGenerated property's DeclaringType should be same as ReflectedType
member.returns: true if [is interceptable type] [the specified t]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Extensions.Internal.TypeExtensions.InterceptableProperties(System.Type)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Return Interceptables properties.
member.remarks:
A property is interceptable if has the following creiteria
1- the property have both Getter and Setter CompilerGenerated accessor
2- The property should be virtual and Public
3- The property's DeclaringType should be same as ReflectedType
member.returns: Interceptable PropertyInfo
